encryptionInTransit.title: Manage encryption in-Transit
encryptionInTransit.enableEIT: Enable encryption in transit for this Universe
encryptionInTransit.useSameCert: Use the same certificate for “Node to Node” and “Client to Node” encryption
encryptionInTransit.enableCNAndNNEncryption: Enable “Node to Node” and “Client to Node” Encryption
encryptionInTransit.useRollingUpgrade: Use rolling upgrade to apply this change
encryptionInTransit.rollingUpgradeInputTitle: Set the upgrade delay between servers (Seconds)
encryptionInTransit.changeCTNCertWarning: Note! Changing the client to node root certificate may cause the client to loose connection, please update the certificate used in your client application.
encryptionInTransit.disableEncryptionWarning: Rotating certificates (Root Certificate or Server Certificate) and Enabling/Disabling encryption should be performed at different times.
encryptionInTransit.rootCAModifiedWarning: You have selected a new Certificates Authority for Node to Node encryption. Rotating a Certificates Authority will automatically rotate its associated Server Certificate.
encryptionInTransit.clientRootCAModifiedWarning: You have selected a new Certificates Authority for Client to Node encryption. Rotating a Certificates Authority will automatically rotate its associated Server Certificate.
encryptionInTransit.enableEITWarning: Enable Node to Node encryption or Client to Node encryption to enable encryption in transit.
encryptionInTransit.disableEITWarning: Note! Enabling/Disabling of “Encryption In Transit” or Enabling/Disabling of “Node to Node” or “Client to Node” encryption will be performed as non rolling upgrade.
encryptionInTransit.xClusterRotateCaWarning: Note! Rotating node to node CA certs for universes participating in xCluster replication as the source universe will interrupt the replication and require a restart of the xCluster config to resume replication after TLS rotation is completed.
encryptionInTransit.xClusterToggleEncryptionWarning: Note! Toggling on/off encryption for universes participating in xCluster replication will interrupt the replication. To enable replication again, please ensure all participating universes have matching TLS encryption setting and restart the affected xCluster configurations.

dbRollbackUpgrade.additionalStep: An additional step is required based on the selected version.
dbRollbackUpgrade.additionalStepInfo: After the upgrade is completed, you'll need to manually finalize the upgrade to finish the process.
dbRollbackUpgrade.rolllingUpgradeLabel: Rolling upgrade (upgrade nodes one at a time)
dbRollbackUpgrade.footerMsg1: Once the upgrade is finished, you can assess Universe performance and
dbRollbackUpgrade.footerMsg2: if any unusual behavior is detected.
dbRollbackUpgrade.rollbackPrevious: roll back to the previous version
dbRollbackUpgrade.xclusterWarning: This universe is part of one or more xCluster replications. To minimize disruptions to these replications during the upgrade process, you should, if possible, upgrade the target universe first.
dbRollbackUpgrade.rollbackModalMsg: Are you sure you wish to roll back to
dbRollbackUpgrade.rollbackOnenode: Rollback one node at a time
dbRollbackUpgrade.rollbackFailedMsg: The rollback of the Universe database upgrade has encountered an issue. To restore the Universe to its normal state, you can choose to either retry the rollback or get in touch our support team.
dbRollbackUpgrade.finalizeFailedMsg: The finalization of the Universe database upgrade has encountered an issue. To restore the Universe to its normal state, you can choose to either retry the finalization or get in touch our support team.
dbRollbackUpgrade.upgradeFailedMsg: The Universe database version upgrade has encountered an issue. To restore the Universe to its normal state, you have the option to either roll back the upgrade or retry the upgrade.
dbRollbackUpgrade.upgradeFialedNonRollback: The Universe database version upgrade has encountered an issue. To restore the Universe to its normal state,you can choose to either retry the upgrade or get in touch our support team.

preFinalize.rollback: Roll back to the previous version
preFinalize.bannerMsg1: Next Step: Evaluate the Universe and finalize the upgrade
preFinalize.bannerMsg2: You should now evaluate the universe performance.
preFinalize.bannerMsg3: If you are OK with the upgrade, click
preFinalize.modalTitle: One last reminder before we proceed...
preFinalize.modalMsg1: After the upgrade is finalized, you won't be able to roll back.
preFinalize.modalMsg2: Make sure you evaluate the universe performance before finalizing the upgrade.

preFinalizeXcluster.modalBody: This universe is associated with one or more xCluster replications. To avoid disrupting replication, you should upgrade all linked universes to version {{version}} before finalizing this universe or any linked universe.

encryptionAtRest.deleteConfigWarning: Before deleting this configuration make sure it's not being used by any backups. Note that in order to restore a backup with deleted KMS config <0></0> you'll need to create a new KMS config with the same master key details.

placementStatus.regionWarning: Primary data placement is geo-redundant, universe can survive at least 1 availability zone failure
placementStatus.singleRF: Primary data placement is not redundant, universe cannot survive even 1 node failure

cloudConfig.title: Cloud Configuration
cloudConfig.colocatedModeHelper: Place Masters on the same nodes as T-Servers
cloudConfig.masterNumNodesHelper: Number of nodes dedicated to Masters is equal to the Universe’s replication factor and can not be modified.
cloudConfig.masterPlacementHelper: Select this option if you plan to use this universe for multi-tenancy use cases -or- you expect to create Databases with a very large number of tables

gFlags.flagNotBelongError: This Flag does not belong to {{server}}. Remove Flag
gFlags.incorrectFlagMsg: Flag name is incorrect. Remove Flag
gFlags.JWKSModalTitle: Paste the JSON web key set (JWKS):
gFlags.JWKSModalNote: Note: You can obtain JWKS from JWKS URI that is part of OIDC discover end point
gFlags.noFlags: There are no flags assigned to this universe
gFlags.title: G-Flags
gFlags.inheritFlagsMsg: Apply the same Flags to primary cluster and Read Replica.
gFlags.rollingMsg: Apply all changes using a rolling restart (slower, zero downtime)
gFlags.nonRollingMsg: Apply all changes immediately, using a concurrent restart (faster, some downtime)
gFlags.nonRestart: Apply all changes which do not require a restart immediately;
gFlags.nonRestartRuntime: apply remaining changes the next time the database is restarted
gFlags.inheritRRModalBody:
Apply the same Flags to both Primary Cluster and Read replica?
This will override all the Flags that are currently applied to Read replica
by Primary Cluster’s Flag.
gFlags.inheritRRModalLine1: Apply the same Flags to both Primary Cluster and Read replica?
gFlags.inheritRRModalLine2: This will override all the Flags that are currently applied to Read replica
gFlags.inheritRRModalConfirmMsg: Are you sure you want to continue with the changes?
gFlags.validationError: Fix all the errors shown below to proceed
gFlags.invalidKey: Invalid attribute key or missing '=' between key value pair
gFlags.jwksNotSupported: Please select database versions 2.18 or above to upload JWKS
gFlags.missingAttributeValue: Missing value for the attribute key
gFlags.missingQuoteAttributeValue: Missing quotes or having spaces within attribute values
gFlags.hbaConfDescription: Input each record as a new row, then reorder them. The sequential order of the records are significant as they are searched serially for every connection request.
gFlags.identConfDescriptionSecond: Enter each mapping as a new row, comprising the map-name, external user name, and database user name.
gFlags.identConfDescriptionMore: To incorporate user name mappings from this flag, add them to the authentication methods that use external user names in hba_conf_csv file.
gFlags.flagsModifiedModalBody1: The Gflags has been modified in another tab/browser/device.
gFlags.flagsModifiedModalBody2: If you don't want to lose modified flags, please reload the page.
gFlags.flagsModifiedModalLine2: Note that current changes will be lost.

instanceConfig.assignPublicIPHelper: Assign a public IP to the DB servers for connections over the internet.
instanceConfig.dedicatedNodesHelper: Place tserver and master processes on separate nodes.
instanceConfig.ephemeralStorage: ! Selected instance type is with ephemeral storage, If you will pause this universe your data will get lost.
instanceConfig.title: Instance Configuration
instanceConfig.useTimeSyncHelper: Enable the {{provider}} Time Sync functionality for the DB servers.

authSettings.title: Authentication Settings
authSettings.enableYsqlOrYcql: Need to enable at least one endpoint among YSQL and YCQL
authSettings.enableYCQLHelper: Enable the YCQL API endpoint to run cassandra compatible workloads.
authSettings.enableYEDISHelper: Enable the YEDIS API endpoint to run REDIS compatible workloads.
authSettings.enableYSQLHelper: Enable the YSQL API endpoint to run postgres compatible workloads.

encryptionSettings.title: Encryption Settings
encryptionSettings.enableClientToNodeTLSHelper: Enable Client-to-Node encryption to use TLS enabled connection for communication between a client (ex: Database application, ysqlsh, ycqlsh) and the Universe YSQL -or- YCQL endpoint.
encryptionSettings.enableEncryptionAtRestHelper: Enable encryption for data stored on the tablet servers.
encryptionSettings.enableNodeToNodeTLSHelper: Enable Node-to-Node encryption to use TLS enabled connections for communication between different Universe nodes.

resizeNodeModal.modalDescription: This operation will be performed without restart

smartResizeModal.modalDescription: This operation will migrate this universe and all its data to a completely new set of nodes Or alternatively you could try smart resize (This will change VM image {{value}} for existing nodes)

placementModal.modalDescription: This operation will scale-up or scale-down the number of the nodes or will change master placement from colocated to dedicated or vice versa
placementModal.modalDescriptionRR: This operation will either scale-up or scale-down the number of the nodes or will change the configuration of number of read replicas

fullMoveModal.modalDescription: This operation will migrate this universe and all its data to a completely new set of nodes.

validation.passwordStrength: Password must be 8 characters minimum and must contain at least 1 digit, 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase and one of the !@#$%^&* (special) characters.
validation.universeNameValidation: {{cloudType}} Universe name cannot contain capital letters or special characters except dashes

advisor.NoPerformanceIssues: Performance Advisor didn't find any performance issues
advisor.FailedToLoad: Failed to load. Try again later
advisor.ReviewLoadBalancing: If you are load balancing in your application or client, review your implementation.
advisor.ScanCluster: Scan the cluster for performance tuning recommendations
advisor.RunWorkload: For meaningful results, run your workload for at least 1 hour before doing a scan.
advisor.IndexPerformanceTuning: Learn more about index performance tuning
advisor.DropIndex: Connect to the database and use DROP INDEX to delete the unused indexes.
advisor.RangeSharding: Recreate the indexes using range sharding
advisor.DBScanFailed: Failed to scan the database. Try again later.

error.failedToFetchUniverseTaskList: Unable to fetch universe task list.

error.failToFetchUniverse: Error fetching details for the universe with the UUID: {{universeUuid}}
error.failToFetchDrConfig: Error fetching details for the DR config with the UUID: {{drConfigUuid}}

enableDrPrompt.featureDescription: Enable <bold>Active-Active Single-Master Disaster Recovery</bold> (DR) for near-zero recovery point objective (RPO) & recovery time objective (RTO) in the event of a universe outage.

tooltip.universeLinkedToTxnXCluster: This universe can't be used for disaster recovery as it is already participating in a transactional xCluster config.

banner.initializingDr: <bold>Initializing disaster recovery...</bold> Universe operations are not available while the operation is in progress.
banner.failoverInProgress: <bold>Failover in progress...</bold> Universe operations are not available while the operation is in progress.
banner.switchoverInProgress: <bold>Switchover in progress...</bold> Universe operations are not available while the operation is in progress.
banner.connectYourApps: <bold>Connect your applications</bold> to the new DR primary universe to direct read and writes to it.
banner.drConfigHalted: <bold>Warning!</bold> DR replication stream has been manually halted.
banner.drConfigRestartRequired: <bold>Warning!</bold> DR replication failed which means the DR replica is severely out-of-sync with the DR primary. -- TODO: Text update.

initiateModal.title: Switchover to DR Replica
initiateModal.titleTooltip: <paragraph>Switch the DR primary with the DR replica after waiting for replication drain so there will be no data loss.</paragraph>Replication drain allows the replication on the DR replica to catch up with the DR primary and be fully synchronized before initiating switchover.
initiateModal.instructions: Wait for the DR replica cluster to be fully synchronized with the primary by <bold>draining replication</bold> before switchover
initiateModal.noDataLoss: There will be <bold>no data loss</bold> in switchover.
initiateModal.switchoverConfirmation: Are you sure you want to switchover to <bold>{{drReplicaName}}</bold>?
initiateModal.confirmationInstructions: Enter DR replica universe name to confirm.

note.stopWorkload: <bold>Stop application workloads</bold> before initiating switchover as all <bold>writes will be rejected</bold> during failover.

success.taskSuccess: Switchover completed. <universeLink><bold>{{sourceUniverseName}}</bold></universeLink> is now your DR primary.

abortModal.title: Abort Switchover
abortModal.description: Aborting switchover will revert the DR configuration to it's pre-switchover state.

initiateModal.title: Failover to DR Replica
initiateModal.description: Start failover immediately at the cost of <bold>losing some data</bold> that is not replicated to the DR replica.

estimatedDataLoss.label: Potential Data Loss
estimatedDataLoss.tooltip: The potential data loss is determined by the DR replica's safe time lag at the last known safe time.

initiateModal.failoverConfirmation: Are you sure you want to failover to <bold>{{drReplicaName}}</bold>?
initiateModal.confirmationInstructions: Enter DR replica universe name to confirm.

success.taskSuccess: Failover completed. <universeLink><bold>{{sourceUniverseName}}</bold></universeLink> is now your DR primary.

useExistingTargetUniverse.description: Create a full copy of {{sourceUniverseName}} on <bold>{{targetUniverseName}}</bold> to bring it up to the same checkpoint as your DR primary to re-establish the replication stream and have a DR replica available for failover.

backupStorageConfig.label: Backup Storage Config
backupStorageConfig.tooltip: <paragraph>Ensure that the backup storage config <bold>can be accessed from both source and target universe.</bold></paragraph><paragraph>Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions.</paragraph>

useNewTargetUniverse.optionName: Select a new universe as DR replica

Halted.label: Halted
Halted.tooltip: The DR replication was halted during the failover as the DR replica is not in sync with the DR primary anymore due to the data loss during failover.

drStatus.label: DR status
drStatus.tooltip: Disaster Recovery (DR) utilizes asynchronous replication to ensure consistency between the primary and standby universe. An unhealthy stream means there is significant replication lag. **TODO: Needs to be updated.

estimatedDataLoss.label: Potential data loss on failover
estimatedDataLoss.tooltip: If you would like to failover, this is the potential data loss measured in time. This estimated is determined by the DR replica's safe time lag at the last known safe time.

instruction.text: Select a universe to use as the DR replica
instruction.tooltip: <paragraph>The DR replica universe acts as a failover in case of a DR primary universe outage. It is asynchronously synchronized for high consistency.</paragraph><paragraph>Select a universe in a <bold>different region</bold> as a DR replica to survive potential region outages.</paragraph>

selectTargetUniverse.drReplicaSelectionHelpText: Make sure the DR replica has the right <drReplicaPrerequisiteDocsLink>prerequisites</drReplicaPrerequisiteDocsLink> for disaster recovery.

error.mismatchedNodeToNodeEncryption: The source and target universe must have matching TLS enable/disable setting.

selectDatabases.instruction: Select the databases to enable disaster recovery for
selectDatabases.pitrSetUpNote: <bold>Note!</bold> Point-in-time Recovery will be enabled for the selected databases on the DR Replica.

configureBootstrap.instruction: Choose the storage config to use for performing the initial copy
configureBootstrap.infoText: Initial full copy is required when the database contains data. Performing an initial full copy requires a backup storage config as an intermediate third party storage, and is time and resource intensive. This is also referred to as bootstrapping or initial seeding.

backupStorageConfig.label: Backup Storage Config
backupStorageConfig.tooltip: <paragraph>Ensure that the backup storage config <bold>can be accessed from both source and target universe.</bold></paragraph><paragraph>Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions.</paragraph>

confirmAlert.instruction: Confirm alert threshold for acceptable replication lag
confirmAlert.infoText: Replication lag measures how far behind in time the DR replica lags the DR primary. In a failover scenario, the longer the lag, the more data is at risk of being lost. To be notified if the lag exceeds a specific threshold so that you can take remedial measures, set a Universe alert for Replication Lag. Learn More
confirmAlert.currentLowestReplicationLagLabel: Lowest replication lag alert threshold on this DR primary universe ({{sourceUniverseName}}):
confirmAlert.setUpReplicationLagAlertPrompt: <paragraph>This DR primary universe does not have any replication lag alert configured. <manageAlertConfigLink>Configure an alert</manageAlertConfigLink></paragraph>

error.requestFailureLabel: Create active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR) request failed
error.taskFailure: Failed to enable active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR).

success.taskSuccess: Active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR) is now enabled.

deleteModal.title: Remove Disaster Recovery
deleteModal.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to remove disaster recovery from <bold>{{currentUniverseName}}</bold>?
deleteModal.deleteConsequence: Your databases will no longer be replicated and there will be no DR replica universe to failover to in case of a disaster.
deleteModal.confirmationInstructions: Enter the current universe name to confirm.

error.requestFailureLabel: Active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR) removal request failed
error.taskFailure: Active-active single-master disaster recovery (DR) removal task failed.

maxAcceptableReplicationLag.info: The lowest alert threshold for replication lag on the DR primary is taken to be the 'max acceptable lag'. Updating the max acceptable replication lag will update the corresponding alert threshold. If the update causes the replication lag alert's threshold to be greater than another from the same universe, then the alert with the lower threshold will be used as the new max acceptable replication lag.

error.backupStorageConfigRequired: Please select a backup storage config.

configureBootstrap.infoText: Initial full copy is required when the database contains data. Performing an initial full copy requires a backup storage config as an intermediate third party storage, and is time and resource intensive. This is also referred to as bootstrapping or initial seeding.

backupStorageConfig.label: Backup Storage Config
backupStorageConfig.tooltip: <paragraph>Ensure that the backup storage config <bold>can be accessed from both source and target universe.</bold></paragraph><paragraph>Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions.</paragraph>

editTablesModal.title: Select Databases and Tables
editTablesModal.instruction: Select the databases to enable disaster recovery for

selectTables.matchingTableNote: <bold>Note!</bold> Only matching databases on both universes are eligible for disaster recovery. Ensure the databases are created with the same name on both universes to enable Disaster Recovery for them.

configureBootstrap.infoText: <paragraph>The selected databases and/or tables contain <bold>data that is not yet replicated</bold> for DR. To enable DR for these databases and/or tables, a fully copy will be required before aynchronous replication from the DR primary universe to the DR replica universe can be established.</paragraph><paragraph>Are you sure you want to perform a <bold>full copy</bold> and add these databases and/or tables?</paragraph>

backupStorageConfig.label: Backup Storage Config
backupStorageConfig.tooltip: <paragraph>Ensure that the backup storage config <bold>can be accessed from both source and target universe.</bold></paragraph><paragraph>Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions.</paragraph>
